title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act". The tragedy of January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's ``Congress on Your Corner'' event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injury of 13 others. This was the first assassination attempt on a Congressional Member in US history. Congresswoman Giffords sustained severe injuries, and Gabe Zimmerman was the first Congressional staffer to be assassinated in the line of duty. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together in the aftermath of the tragedy. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together in the days following the tragedy to provide comfort and support at three memorial sites. Tucson's January 8th Memorial will honor those who died and showcase the resilience of the community and democracy in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial will honor those who died in the tragedy and showcase the resilience of the community and democracy in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Secretary of the Interior, will be affiliated with the National Park System once the Foundation complies with requirements. The Memorial will honor those who died in the tragedy and demonstrate community resilience and democracy in the United States. The Memorial will not be established until the Foundation sets up a trust fund for donations and management. The Memorial will consist of a specific area and the Foundation will be responsible for its construction and maintenance. If the Foundation fails to manage the Memorial properly, it will no longer be affiliated with the National Park System. The Memorial's administration includes requirements for management and maintenance. The Foundation must manage the Memorial according to laws applicable to National Park System units and maintain a trust fund. The map must be available for public inspection at National Park Service offices. The Secretary can provide technical assistance and financial aid for marketing through cooperative agreements with the Foundation. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using federal funds for the Memorial's construction, operation, maintenance, or management. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using federal funds for the Memorial's construction, operation, maintenance, or management. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, must develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with specified regulations. The completed plan must be provided to the relevant congressional committees within 3 years of funds availability or Memorial establishment.
